properties.publicTransport:
A FREE shuttle buses will run from Canley Vale and Canley Heights to Cabramatta, from 9am until 8:30pm.


Buses will be diverting and missing stops while road closures are in place. The bus interchange at Cabramatta Station will also be temporarily relocated to Railway Pde, between McBurney Rd and Hughes St. Services will start and end their trips at the temporary stops located here. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the annual Cabramatta Moon Festival held on John St from 11am to 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on Joseph St, Railway Pde, Cumberland Hwy and Cabramatta Rd West as crowds travel to and from the event. 

From 8pm on Saturday the night before, sections of John Street, Cabramatta Road West, Park Road and Arthur Street in the Cabramatta CBD will be closed until midnight on Sunday. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.

Additional closures will in place on Dutton Lane and Railway Pde from midnight Saturday. 

Arthur St car park will close from 6am on Saturday until midnight Sunday, and Hughes St car park will be closed from 8pm Saturday until midnight Sunday.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
CABRAMATTA

8PM SATURDAY 27 AUGUST TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY 28 AUGUST

  • John St between Hill St and Cabramatta Rd West
  • Cabramatta Rd West at Railway Pde
  • Park Rd between Hughes St and John St
  • Arthur St between Park Rd and Railway Pde

MIDNIGHT SATURDAY 27 AUGUST TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY 28 AUGUST

  • Dutton Lane
  • Railway Pde between Hughes St and the Cabramatta Rd West overbridge

webLinks.linkText: UCI Road World Championships 2022 - road closures

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
The UCI Road World Championships will be hosted in Wollongong, with eight days of competitive cycle racing from 18 to 25 September and a training day on Saturday 17 September.

Major road closures and extensive special event clearways will be in effect for the duration of the event at various times.

The M1 Princes Mwy, Memorial Dr and the Princes Hwy (except for a section in Fairy Meadow) will remain open throughout the event.

There will be closures on Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Masters Rd, Springhill Rd, Five Islands Rd and the Princes Hwy at Unanderra on Saturday 24 and Sunday 25 September only.

Towradgi Rd and Balgownie Rd will also remain open and provide a connection to the suburbs of Mt Ousley, Fairy Meadow, Towradgi and Balgownie.

Road closures for each day are displayed in the interactive maps below

  • Training - Saturday 17 September - closures from 7.30am to 12pm/5pm
  • Day 1 – Sunday 18 September - closures from 8am to 6pm
  • Day 2 – Monday 19 September - closures from 11.30am to 6pm
  • Day 3 – Tuesday 20 September - closures from 8am to 6pm
  • Day 4 – Wednesday 21 September - closures from 12.30pm to 6pm
  • Day 5 – Thursday 22 September - closures from 8am to 1.30pm
  • Day 6 – Friday 23 September - closures from 7am to 6pm
  • Day 7 – Saturday 24 September - closures between 6.45am and 3.30pm
  • Day 8 – Sunday 25 September - closures between 8.45am and 6pm

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads along and surrounding the event courses through Wollongong and surrounding suburbs between Thursday 15 September and Sunday 25 September.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Princes Highway, Corrimal Street, Squires Way, Pioneer Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Hilltop Hoods at Qudos Bank Arena. Main act from 9pm, finish approx. 10:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
City Tattersalls Club Cup Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:40am, last race at 5:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Traffic will also be heavier than usual after the event as crowds travel to the nearby Allianz Stadium in Moore Park for an NRL match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 6am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

arrangementElements.html:

Wests Tigers v Sharks at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 4:05pm and full time around 6:05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Dragons v Broncos at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full-time approx. 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Sharks at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 2pm and full time approx. 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Bulldogs v Sea Eagles at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm, full-time around 7:45pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encourage to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW interactive road closure and clearway map - Sydney Running Festival 2022

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is covered for participants and volunteers. Extra trains and buses will run. Buses and light rail services will be affected due to road closures. Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 35,000 people are expected to participate in one of four course for Sydney’s most iconic running event, Sydney Running Festival, on Sunday 18 September. Significant road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD, Milsons Point, Darlinghurst, Pyrmont and Moore Park between 4am and 1.30pm for Sydney Running Festival events.

Major roads will close from 4am including the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Western Distributor between Pyrmont and the City. There will be no direct vehicle access between the Harbour Bridge and Anzac Bridge until after midday. Citybound motorists on the Western Distributor will be diverted via Bathurst St off-ramp to the city and Sydney Harbour Bridge motorists will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel. You can continue to walk, cycle or catch a train across the Sydney Harbour Bridge while it is closed to vehicle traffic.

Key road closures:

  • 4am to 11am – Sydney Harbour Bridge, Milsons Point & Darlinghurst: full closure of the Harbour Bridge including the Cahill Expressway and all on-ramps. All traffic will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel in both directions. Motorists should consider the Victoria Rd and Gladesville Bridge detour route to travel to and from the city during this time instead as long delays are expected in the Harbour Tunnel. In Milsons Point, Alfred St South, Lavender St, Middlemiss St, Broughton St and Olympic Dr will close. In Darlinghurst, Oxford St and Flinders St will be closed.
  • 4am to 11.30am – Sydney CBD and Circular Quay: sections of George St, Bridge St, College St, Macquarie St, Hunter St, Phillip St and Young St will be closed. Macquarie St north of Bridge St remains closed until 12pm.
  • 4am to 12pm – Barangaroo and Western Distributor Pyrmont to CBD: the Western Distributor will be closed between Pyrmont and the city including all on and off-ramps. All citybound traffic on the Anzac Bridge will be diverted via the Bathurst St off-ramp. No direct access between the Anzac Bridge and Sydney Harbour Bridge until 12pm. The Pyrmont St on-ramp will remain closed until 12:30pm. Sections of Sussex St and roads in Barangaroo will also close.
  • 4am to 12.30pm – Pyrmont: Pirrama Rd, Murray St, Bowman St, Union St and surrounding local roads will close. The northern end of Pirrama Rd and roads in Darling Island will be closed from 1am.
  • 4am to 1.30pm – The Rocks, Walsh Bay and Millers Point: Hickson Rd from George St to Barton St and Circular Quay West will be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on major roads along and surrounding the course from 1am in Milsons Point, the city and Pyrmont and from 4am in Darlinghurst and Moore Park. All clearways will be lifted by 1.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to residents with local council parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest available legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

roads.suburb: Milsons Point, Sydney CBD, Moore Park, Darlinghurst and Pyrmont

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Fairfield Spring Fest held on Harris and William Streets from 12pm to 8pm on Saturday and Sunday.

From 7pm Friday 23 September, sections of William Street, Harris Street and Downey Lane will be closed until 5am Monday 26 September. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Fairfield while the event is underway. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
FAIRFIELD

7PM FRIDAY 23 SEPTEMBER TO 5AM MONDAY 26 SEPTEMBER

  • William St between Harris St and Hamilton Rd
  • Harris St between Barbara St and Ware St
  • Southern end of Downey Lane (near Harris St)

NOTE: There will be limited access for residents, businesses and service vehicles to the abovementioned closures between 7pm Friday 23 September and midnight Saturday 24 September, and between midnight and 5am Monday 26 September.

properties.otherAdvice:
Wallabies v Springboks at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 7:20pm and full-time around 9:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Rd and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd (both car parks open from 4:30pm).

The Eastern Distributor Bondi exit to Moore Park Rd will be closed from 9:30pm to 11pm for the safety of pedestrians leaving the stadium. Use the Randwick exit during this time for access to Moore Park.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

NRL: Eels v Storm at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:50pm and full-time around 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close from approximately 9:25 until 9:55pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue:

  • O'Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street
  • Ross Street from O'Connell Street to Trott Street
  • Victoria Road from O'Connell Street to Villiers Street

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Right hand turns from Griffiths Road into the Newcastle Entertainment Centre and Showground (NECS) may be restricted. Left hand turns into the NECS will not be impacted.

Motorists are asked to be patient, follow signs and instructions from Police and traffic controllers.

Southern Stars Arena Spectacular at WIN Entertainment Centre. Friday show starts from 7pm, and Saturday shows start from 1pm and 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Sports and Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

KISS Concert at Qudos Bank Arena. Doors open nightly at 6pm, main act starts from 9pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice: For more information please visit the event website.

Up to 5,000 participants will take part in the annual Beach2Beach Charity Fun Run and Festival from Dee Why to Newport. Events start from 8am and will finish at around 1pm at Newport Beach. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants. Access for local residents will be maintained when safe to do so after runners have safely passed by along the course.

  • Collaroy from 7am to 10am: Sections of Beach Rd and Florence Ave will be closed.
  • Collaroy to Narrabeen from 7am to 10am: no general traffic access to streets off Pittwater Rd along the beachfront between Fielding St in Collaroy and Goodwin St in Narrabeen, including car parks/driveways. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on the southbound lanes of Pittwater Rd between Alexander St and Devitt St from 5am to 10am, with a single lane closure in place.
  • Collaroy to Dee Why from 7am to 10am: Southbound lanes closures in place on Pittwater Road between Anzac Avenue and Hawkesbury Avenue. 
  • Warriewood from 7.30am to 11am: Sections of Peal Pl, Melbourne Ave and Narrabeen Park Pde around Turimetta Beach. Narrabeen Park Pde southbound lanes will be closed between Cook Tce and Sydney Rd, Warriewood. One-way traffic northbound only will be maintained.
  • Mona Vale from 7.30am to 1pm: Sections of Bassett St, Orana Rd, Surfview Rd and Grandview Pde will be closed with one-way traffic arrangements in place – follow directions of traffic controllers. Access for residents will be maintained. Parking restrictions will be in place on sections of Orana Rd and Grandview Pde.
  • Newport from 7.30am to 1pm: Sections of Ross St, Palm Rd, Myola Rd and Calvert Pde around the Beach will be closed with one-way traffic arrangements in place. Access for residents maintained – follow directions of traffic controllers. From 5am to 1pm the speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on the southbound lanes of Barrenjoey Rd from The Boulevarde in Newport to Grandview Pde in Mona Vale with a single lane closure in place.

Special event clearways will be in place on sections of Pittwater Rd from 4am until 9:30am from Dee Why to Collaroy, and on Barrenjoey Rd from Newport to Mona Vale from 4am until 12pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle type and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Orana Rd between Grandview Pde and Bassett St (Northbound)

Thousands of ticketholders are expected to attend the Community Open day & Night events for the new Allianz Stadium in Moore Park. Day session runs from 11am until 3pm, and night session is from 5pm until 9pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium from 10am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the event. Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Rd and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 10am until 10pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.
